title: Clicking close on the applications X with a panel open presents an are you sure type message - but response is ignored
author: MrChriZ
body_snippet:
<!--- Provide a general summary of the issue in the Title above -->

## Expected Behavior
Clicking close on the applications X with a panel open presents the message
_Are you sure you want to close the panel, "General"?..._
Clicking no should then prevent the panel, and therefore the application from closing, application remains on the taskbar.

## Current Behavior
The application disappears from the task bar  - although it remains running in the system tray.

comments.author: robertpopa22
comments.snippet:
Implemented in PR #3124 from fork branch codex/pr20-main-close-cancel-2270. 
 
Scope: 
- main close path now waits for child panel close result before hiding/shutdown 
- if panel close is cancelled (No), app close is cancelled and main window remains visible 
 
Validation: 
- local full MSBuild restore/build passed (Release/x64)
